description: Presented paper on the ethical implications of AI in human society, inspired by *Cyberpunk: Edgerunners*.
Presented a discussion on narrative structures in anime, referencing *Jujutsu Kaisen*'s complex storytelling.
Presented research on mental health representation in anime, focusing on *The Eminence in Shadow* and its portrayal of isolation and self-worth.
Presented paper on the relationship between human nature and mythical creatures in *Demon Slayer* and other recent anime.
Discussed the impact of cultural traditions in modern anime storytelling, with references to *Vinland Saga*.
Presented on the evolution of anti-hero tropes in anime, with an in-depth analysis of *Attack on Titan* and *Chainsaw Man*.
Explored the philosophical themes of justice and revenge in *Tokyo Revengers*, and how they resonate with contemporary societal issues.
Presented on the integration of social justice themes in recent anime, focusing on *Beastars* and its exploration of prejudice and societal structures.
Discussed the portrayal of family dynamics and love in *Spy x Family*, and its impact on viewers' emotional responses.
Presented on the influence of *Ranking of Kings* in reshaping the portrayal of disabilities and leadership in anime.
